Articles.Content: Ok, so I haven't played KSP in a while because I didn't have enough RAM to support .24 with all my mods, now that I've tripled my RAM though I came back and installed a ton of stuff. But when the game loads MM says 9 modules couldn't be loaded and were hidden, or something like that. It's been a while since I've messed with MM, where do I go to see which mods weren't loaded?

IIRC, hidden modules means that you don't have mods\plugins for them to apply. For example, Tantares includes MM patch for Deadly Reentry. If you don't have DRE - that patch won't be applied and will be "hidden".
Working as designed, it's a good thing.

ok, I thought I got all the dependencies, but I wasn't being a good modder and installing everything one at a time, I just dumped all these mods in Gamedata because I was in a hurry to get my game working the way I liked again. Plus, I found out half way through that my virus scanner didn't like the DLLs, so it might have 86ed some of them before I caught on. Is there a log file that will tell me what dependencies I'm missing? Or at least what mods were disabled?

Edited October 1, 2014 by Capt. Hunt

Often the hidden patches are for mods you don't need to have installed. For example, Space Plane Plus includes support for Deadly Reentry, NEAR, FAR, and RPM, but doesn't require any of them. If you don't have them, Module Manager will hide those patches.
